docs.lead_paragraph: A Missouri lawmaker fighting required birth control coverage in his state-sponsored insurance plan is relying on the U.S. Supreme Court's recent Hobby Lobby ruling as he contests a lower court's rejection of his legal challenge to the Affordable Care Act mandate.

headline.main: Missouri Lawmaker Challenges Birth Control Mandate
headline.print_headline: Missouri Lawmaker Challenges Birth Control Mandate

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic Governor Terry McAuliffe proposed a plan on Monday to provide medical insurance for 25,000 uninsured Virginians, a move that falls short of his vow to expand coverage to 400,000 people despite Republican objections.

headline.main: Virginia Governor Unveils More Modest Medicaid Expansion Plan
headline.print_headline: Virginia Governor Unveils More Modest Medicaid Expansion Plan

docs.snippet: Democratic Governor Terry McAuliffe proposed a plan on Monday to provide medical insurance for 25,000 uninsured Virginians, a move that falls short of his vow to expand coverage to 400,000 people despite Republican objections.

docs.lead_paragraph: With climate change still a political minefield across the nation despite the strong scientific consensus that it's happening, some community leaders have hit upon a way of preparing for the potentially severe local consequences without triggering explosions of partisan warfare: Just change the subject.

headline.main: Cities Prepare for Warm Climate Without Saying So
headline.print_headline: Cities Prepare for Warm Climate Without Saying So

docs.lead_paragraph: The campaign focuses on life, not death, in urging consumers to buy insurance.

headline.main: MetLife Hopes Campaign Will Help Change Perceptions of Life Insurance

docs.snippet: The campaign focuses on life, not death, in urging consumers to buy insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act will greatly affect health care costs in the next decade and beyond, but in what ways is still unclear.

headline.main: The Ebb and Flow of Health Spending
headline.print_headline: The Ebb and Flow of Health Spending

docs.abstract: Editorial contends latest federal estimates of health care spending show that spending is expected to rise faster than growth in economy over next 10 years; raises question of what role Affordable Care Act has played and will play in prodding health care system to adopt more efficient practices.
docs.snippet: The Affordable Care Act will greatly affect health care costs in the next decade and beyond, but in what ways is still unclear.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Users are discovering that marijuana’s strides toward the mainstream are running aground at the office, where drug-free policies remain.

headline.main: Legal Use of Marijuana Clashes With Job Rules
headline.print_headline: Legal Use of Marijuana Clashes With Job Rules

docs.abstract: Legalization of marijuana is running afoul of drug-free policies at most offices, creating clash between a culture that increasingly accepts marijuana and companies that will fire employees who use it; situation is particularly tricky when workers are dismissed for using medical marijuana.
docs.snippet: Users are discovering that marijuana’s strides toward the mainstream are running aground at the office, where drug-free policies remain.

docs.lead_paragraph: The very bad economics of independence.
docs.abstract: Paul Krugman Op-Ed column warns Scotland faces significant economic risks of it leaves the United Kingdom; maintains Scotland has made it clear that it intends to keep the pound as national currency, and combination of political independence with a shared currency is a recipe for disaster.
docs.snippet: The very bad economics of independence.

docs.lead_paragraph: Just as the iPod’s appeal relied in part on Apple’s music industry relationships, the future of its new wrist device may rest on courting health companies.

headline.main: Success of Apple’s iWatch May Rely on Health Care Partnerships
headline.print_headline: Success of Apple Smartwatch May Rely on Health Care Partnerships

docs.abstract: Apple hopes to replicate its experience with iPod when it introduces so-called smartwatch; if company gets it right, product, which media has dubbed the iWatch, could be first to make average people want to own the device.
docs.snippet: Just as the iPod’s appeal relied in part on Apple’s music industry relationships, the future of its new wrist device may rest on courting health companies.
